title: Perma-Banned Account
body: Should an account be perma banned for saying they don't feel like winning a game because another player is being toxic and they lose the will to win the game? Just out of curiosity. Is it really fair to be playing the game for 6 years and be perma banned because you gave into another players toxicity? If you start it, fine give them the perma ban. But you mean to tell me that with how much time, money, effort, and support that I've given this game, that I'm gonna get banned because I didn't want to win a game that someone else was ruining for me and the rest of my team? And then say that its "continued" behavior when it was one game. It would be really nice to have some input on what the reason is behind it. The reason I received from riot support was terrible. He said that my negative behavior continued after my 2 week ban. The 2 week ban was deserved but I said a word that wasn't very nice but it's not exactly like I'm toxic a lot. I would really love to have another chance or someone else check out my ban. I don't believe it's a decision that one person should make.

replies.body: The way i understand it a 2 week ban is your FINAL chance to reform. This means if you received a 2 week ban you have to be very careful about your behavior. This is due to the fact that things that you could normally get away with if you were never punished before could be the last straw that ultimately resulted in a permanent ban.

You were warned at your two week ban that continued violations of the Summoner's Code would possibly result in a permanent suspension. You continued to perpetuate your negative attitude in the game after your two week ban. You could've used the mute button to not have to see the toxic player, but you chose to let it affect you.

Being negative or perpetuating a negative attitude about the game (such as trying to give up, trying to push your team to forfeit/surrender, etc) are not permitted. Your team queued up for the game with the expectation that they were going to try to win from minute 0 to the nexus falling. They had a setback when they had to deal with a toxic player, but the last thing they wanted after that was to deal with a teammate giving up and not wanting to win.

I don't understand how just because you don't like it the support was "terrible". They gave you the reasoning for the ban - you were warned and didn't heed the warning.

You play the game in whichever way you choose, if i choose not to win. Its how i enjoy playing, its not really me being toxic its saying how I feel and playing the way i like but if i hadn't said anything in chat and just threw the game by seeing his toxicity would my ban still have occurred. So now we have a predicament. If i never said that I gave up in the first place and just threw how would it have been then. Would they still have banned me without me saying that I didn't want to win because someone on my team was being toxic. Hmm. Funny. They could have checked the game. I did fine the whole time. I never fed or actually threw I just typed it. And the person that reported me, happened to be the toxic player because i received 3 honors that game. And the whole idea of muting someone is to not read what they say. But if you don't know that they are going to be toxic and you read what they said, they react. That't what happens. For every action there is a reaction. And it was terrible in a sense that I just didn't feel like going to screenshot it to show everyone. Although I could do that. But it takes 3 reports to trigger a ban but they only found a flaw in one of the games. Where the other 2 games didn't have negative behavior.

It is certainly your right to not play the game to win.

It is not your right to impose your negative attitude (your attitude that winning isn't important) on other players. If you constantly tried to give up, tried to convince your team to give up, or talked about giving up, you can be punished.

It does not take 3 reports to trigger a ban. It takes only one game. Usually the system will give you multiple chat logs, but if you only recently came off another suspension it is not uncommon or unrealistic for you to be punished quickly for one game of poor behavior. After your 14 day ban, you were supposed to be on your best behavior, and if the system sees continued negativity while you're supposed to be on your best behavior, it'll bring down the hammer quickly.

I never forced it onto other people and I don't constantly try to give up. And if you have really played this game then you should realize that when you're doing good and someone gives up and starts being toxic to you and your team and it doesn't get under your skin. Then either you don't care about winning, or you're a robot. And one of those is the reason I got banned from playing a game I love so much.

Well, if you didn't force your negative attitude on others, you should have no problem posting your chat logs to prove it.

Further, I never said you're not allowed to be frustrated at a teammate being toxic or not helping. That's actually *normal* for you to get that way. You are not, however, allowed to respond to their toxicity by adding to it with more toxicity or negativity, which is what it sounds like you did here.

So you fed and got banned.

Yes, that is deserved.
